Now, suppose we denote the two points where the equilateral triangle and the right triangle meet as A and B. Then, the segment connecting the other two vertices of the triangles is the difference between two sides of the equilateral triangle, which is $6 - 6\sqrt{3}$.

But since we want the distance, which is always positive, the distance between the two vertices that the triangles do not have in common is $6\sqrt{3} - 6$.
